attributes.title: Figure 6 In A New Species Of The Natricine Snake Genus Amphiesma From The Indochinese Region (Squamata: Colubridae: Natricinae)
attributes.description: FIGURE 6. Holotype in life of Amphiesma leucomystax spec. nov. (ZFMK 71702, adult female). General view. Photograph by T. Ziegler.

attributes.description: FIGURE 7. Holotype in life of Amphiesma leucomystax spec. nov. (ZFMK 71702, adult female). Close-up view of the head. Photograph by T. Ziegler.

attributes.description: FIGURE 8. Paratype in life of Amphiesma leucomystax spec. nov. (ZFMK 71704, adult female). Photograph by T. Ziegler.

attributes.description: FIGURE 10. Left maxilla of Amphiesma leucomystax spec. nov. (MNHN 2006.0447, adult female). Scale bar = 1 mm.

attributes.description: FIGURE 11. Partly everted hemipenes of Amphiesma leucomystax spec. nov. (PNKB RH 06213). Photograph by R. Hendrix.

attributes.title: Figure 1 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 1. Dorsal (A) and ventral (B) views of the holotype of Micrurus tikuna (MPEG 18199).

attributes.title: Figure 2 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 2. Dorsal (A), ventral (B), and lateral (C) views of the head of the holotype of Micrurus tikuna (MPEG 18199). Scale bar = 10 mm.

attributes.title: Figure 3 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 3. Schematic comparisons of the general color pattern between: Micrurus tikuna (A—MPEG 18199, holotype), M. albicinctus (B—MNRJ 376, holotype), M. annellatus annellatus (C—ZMB 7185, holotype), M. margaritiferus (D—USNM 316649, holotype), M. medemi (E—MSL 1517, holotype), M. putumayensis (F—AMNH 110058, holotype), M. steindachneri steindachneri (G—AMNH 35820), M. steindachneri orcesi (H—UMMZ 88922, holotype), M. petersi (I—USNM 158295), and M. mertensi (J— FMNH 18300, holotype).

attributes.title: Figure 4 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 4. General color pattern of body of the Micrurus albicinctus (A—MPEG 18133), M. annellatus annellatus (B—USNM 247525), M. margaritiferus (C—USNM 316649, holotype), M. medemi (D—MSL 1517, paratype), M. putumayensis (E—AMNH 110058, holotype), and M. steindachneri steindachneri (F—AMNH 35820).

attributes.title: Figure 5 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 5. Schematic comparisons of the general color pattern between: Micrurus tikuna (A—MPEG 18199, holotype), M. peruvianus (B—MCZ 17385), M. annellatus bolivianus (C—ZMB 7185, holotype), M. averyi (D—FMNH 30956, holotype), M. catamayensis (E—BMNH 1935.11. 3.103, holotype), M. langsdorffi (F—INPA – H AL 13), M. ornatissimus (G—BMNH 80.12.8.134), M. pacaraimae (H—MZUSP 8565, holotype), M. paraensis (I—MPEG 851, holotype), and M. remotus (J—USNM 266100, holotype).

attributes.title: Figure 6 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 6. General color pattern of body of the Micrurus steindachneri orcesi (A—UMMZ 88922, holotype), M. petersi (B—USNM 158295), M. mertensi (C—FMNH 18300, holotype), M. peruvianus (D—MCZ 17385), M. annellatus bolivianus (VRM 18527), and M. averyi (F—FMNH 30956, holotype).

attributes.title: Figure 7 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 7. General color pattern of body of the M. catamayensis (A—BMNH 1935.11. 3.103, holotype), M. langsdorffi (B—IAvH 4385), M. ornatissimus (C—BMNH 80.12.8.134), M. pacaraimae (D—MZUSP 8565, holotype), M. paraensis (E—MPEG 851, holotype), and M. remotus (F—USNM 266100, holotype).

attributes.title: Figure 8 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 8. General color pattern of M. tikuna in life from Leticia, Colombia. Photo by Silva Haad.

attributes.title: Figure 9 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 9. Dorsal (A) and ventral (B) views of the paratype of Micrurus tikuna (ICN 10853).

attributes.title: Figure 10 In A New Species Of Monadal Coral Snake Of The Genus Micrurus (Serpentes, Elapidae) From Western Amazon
attributes.description: FIGURE 10. Geographic distribution of Micrurus tikuna. Star = type-locality and circle = additional material.

attributes.title: Figure 1 In A New Genus And Species Of Xenodermatid Snake (Squamata: Caenophidia: Xenodermatidae) From Northern Lao People'S Democratic Republic
attributes.description: FIGURE 1. Phylogenetic hypothesis based on the maximum likelihood. Numbers above and under branches are MP / ML bootstrap values and Bayesian posterior probabilities, respectively. Asterisk represents 100 % BP value or 1 PP value.

attributes.title: Figure 2 In A New Genus And Species Of Xenodermatid Snake (Squamata: Caenophidia: Xenodermatidae) From Northern Lao People'S Democratic Republic
attributes.description: FIGURE 2. Parafimbrios lao spec. nov., holotype (MNHN 2013.1002): A) Close-up view of the head and of the dorsal scalation at midbody and B) Ventral view. Photographs: A. Teynié.

attributes.title: Figure 3 In A New Genus And Species Of Xenodermatid Snake (Squamata: Caenophidia: Xenodermatidae) From Northern Lao People'S Democratic Republic
attributes.description: FIGURE 3. Parafimbrios lao spec. nov., holotype (MNHN 2013.1002), alive in its natural biotope, Ngoi District, Louangphabang Province, Laos: A) General view and B) Close-up view of head. Photographs: A. Teynié.

attributes.title: Figure 4 In A New Genus And Species Of Xenodermatid Snake (Squamata: Caenophidia: Xenodermatidae) From Northern Lao People'S Democratic Republic
attributes.description: FIGURE 4. Parafimbrios lao spec. nov., the second specimen in life in natural biotope, Vieng Xai District District, Houaphan Province, Laos: A) View of head and B) Close-up view of the body showing dorsal ranks of scales. Note the two dorsal rows above each ventral scale, an almost unique condition in snakes that is also present in the monotypic genus Xenodermus of the same family. Photographs: A. Teynié.

attributes.title: Figure 5 In A New Genus And Species Of Xenodermatid Snake (Squamata: Caenophidia: Xenodermatidae) From Northern Lao People'S Democratic Republic
attributes.description: FIGURE 5. Views of head of Parafimbrios lao spec. nov compared with those of the two known species of the genus Fimbrios: Parafimbrios lao spec. nov., holotype (MNHN 2013.1002): A) dorsal view and B) lateral view; C) Fimbrios klossi, Paksong, Champasak Province, Laos; and D) Fimbrios smithi, holotype (IEBR 3157), Phong Nha – Ke Bang National Park, Quang Binh Province, Vietnam. Photographs: A. Teynié (A – C) and T. Ziegler (D).

attributes.title: Figure 6 In A New Genus And Species Of Xenodermatid Snake (Squamata: Caenophidia: Xenodermatidae) From Northern Lao People'S Democratic Republic
attributes.description: FIGURE 6. Comparative general views in life: A) Fimbrios klossi, Paksong, Champasak Province, Laos and B) Parafimbrios lao spec. nov. (MNHN 2013.1002), Muang Ngoi, Ngoi District, Louangphabang Province, Laos. Photographs: A. Teynié.

attributes.title: Figure 7 In A New Genus And Species Of Xenodermatid Snake (Squamata: Caenophidia: Xenodermatidae) From Northern Lao People'S Democratic Republic
attributes.description: FIGURE 7. Comparative distributions of Parafimbrios lao with species of the genus Fimbrios: Parafimbrios lao: (1) Ngoi District, Luangphrabang Province, Laos (type locality); (2) Vieng Xai district, Houaphan Province. - Fimbrios smithi: (3) Phong Nha—Ke Bang National Park, Quang Binh Province, Vietnam (type locality). - Fimbrios klossi: Vietnam: (4) Quang Tri Province, (5) Thua Thien—Hue Province, (6) Kon Tum Province, (7) Quang Ngai Province, (8) Gia Lai Province, (9) Dak Lak Province, (10) Langbian Plateau, Lam Dong Province (type locality); Laos: (11) Paksong, Boloven Highlands, Champasak Province; and Cambodia: (12) Bokor, Kampot Province (Notes: Orlov et al. [2003] mentioned only provincial records of Fimbrios klossi in southern Vietnam without precise localities. As a consequence, corresponding numbers (localities Nr 4 to 6) are placed approximately in the centre of the corresponding provinces.

attributes.title: Figure 8 In A New Genus And Species Of Xenodermatid Snake (Squamata: Caenophidia: Xenodermatidae) From Northern Lao People'S Democratic Republic
attributes.description: FIGURE 8. General view of the biotope of Parafimbrios lao at the type locality in Louangphabang Province, Laos. Photograph: A. Teynié.

attributes.title: Figure 1 In A Cryptic New Species Of Indigo Snake (Genus Drymarchon) From The Florida Platform Of The United States
attributes.description: FIGURE 1. Proposed differences in supralabial morphology between the A) Western Indigo Snake, Drymarchon melanurus erebennus (Cope, 1860), and B) Eastern Indigo Snake, D. couperi (Holbrook, 1842), after Baird & Girard (1853). Illustrations originally taken from Cope (1900) and modified after Conant (1958).

data_centers.title: UC Berkeley Museum of Vertebrate Zoology
